Welcome to AirQuant’s documentation!

Contents:

  • AirQuant

tube

Base class of Airquant

Tube is a really cool module.

Tube

Base class of tubes

class tube.Tube

Bases: handle

Initialise the Tube class object.

description

Parameters

  • network (AirQuant.network) – tube network object that this tube is a subset.

  • parent (AirQuant.tube) – parent tube objects

  • children (AirQuant.tube) – child tube objects

  • localsegpoints (int, vector) – list of indexed points that make up the tube’s local segmentation

  • skelpoints (int, vector) – list of indexed points that make up the tube’s centreline

  • spline (struct) – polynomial that describes the spline

  • arclength (float, vector) – interval along spline in mm

  • reformedsource (float, array) – tube patches of source image along spline at interval specifed by arclength

  • reformedseg (float, array) – tube patches of seg image along spline at interval specifed by arclength

  • stats (struct) – stats of current tube

see also AIRWAY

AirwayImageAll()

Traverse all airway segments except the trachea.

ComputeBranchCharacteristics()

Add parent and child links, and calculate length of airways. Save these to class to keep track of airway characteristics.

ComputeDmapD(CT_point)

Convert CT_point mm back to voxel ind

ComputeEllipses(FWHM_points)

Perform the Ellipitcal fitting The output will be sturct containing the major and minor lengths as well as all the stop points

ComputeIntegratedVol(prunelength, idx)

Compute the intertapering value for all airways based on integrated volume along airway.

ComputeIntegratedVolAll(prunelength)

Compute the intertapering value for all airways based on integrated volume along airway.

ComputeInterIntegratedVol(prunelength)

Compute the intertapering value for all airways based on integrated volume along airway.

ComputeIntraTaper(prunelength, idx, plotflag)

prunelength given as a 2 element vector, the length in mm to ignore at the begining and end of the branch.

ComputeLobarInterTaper(prunelength)

TODO: great potential for improving efficiency. Compare every lobar airway with the diameter of the first airway of that lobe.

static ComputeNormal(spline, point)

Based on original function by Kin Quan 2018 * interperate real point on spline

ComputeSpline(link_index)

Computes a smooth spline of a single graph edge. Based on original function by Kin Quan 2018

ComputeSplinePoints(link_index)

  • Compute Spline if necessary

ComputeTaperAll()

get list of terminal branches

static ComputeTaperGrad(arclength, area)

identify NaN data points

ComputeTortuosity()

La = Arclengths; Le = Euclidean lengths

CreateAirwayImage(link_index)

Constructs perpendicular images as if travelling along an airway segment in CT image and Segmentation.

FindFWHMall()

Clear all FWHMesl cells

GetAreas()

Extract the inner area of all branches from FWHM results and output

GetDiameters()

Extract the inner area of all branches from FWHM results, convert to diameter and output.

GraphPlotIT()

graph plot for plotting intertapering relative to edgethicknes.

InterpolateCT(normal, CT_point, plane_sz, plane_sample_sz)

Interpolates a CT plane of the image. Based on original function by Kin Quan 2018

LobeAvgPlot(metric)

visualise average of each generation across upper and lower lobes for intra/inter/avg values.

static LobeLabels()

returns cell of lobe lables used in AirQuant

OrthoViewAirway(link_index)

View a series of an airway segment’s slices as a volume image stack using MATLAB’s inbuilt othogonal 3d viewer.

PlotAirway(link_index, slide)

display image

PlotAirway3(link_index)

Plot resampled airway slices overlayed with FWHMesl ray cast points and fitted ellipse

PlotMap3D(mode)

Recommend to use View3D if colour labels appear buggy.

PlotSeg()

plot segmentation

PlotSegSkel()

plot segmentation and skeleton within each other.

PlotSplineTree()

loop through every branch, check spline has already been computed, compute if necessary. Skip trachea. Plot spline. TODO: This may not work as well when VoxelSize ~= [1,1,1]

PlotSplineVecs(subsamp, link_index)

Plot and Visualise tangental vectors off spline sample points. 1/subsamp = proportion of spline points to sample, default subsamp = 2. link_index = airway indices to plot, default link_index = all.

PlotTree(gen, show_seg_txt, show_node_txt)

Plot the airway tree with nodes and links in image space. Set gen to the maximum number of generations to show. Original Function by Ashkan Pakzad on 27th July 2019.

Raycast(interpslice, interpseg, center)

Compute Rays Getting the range limit of the ray which will be the shortest distance from the centre to the bounadry Need to find the limits of the raw

ReformatAirway(link_index, slice_idx)

get reformatted airway stack

SegmentTaperAll(prunelength)

high level function to compute the segmental tapering measurement of all airways.

SetBranch(ParentNode, ChildNode, IgnoredLink)

Set branch characteristics

SetCT(CTDimRed, VoxDim)

CTDimRed - 6 element vector of top left to bottom right extremes of CT image VoxDim - 3 element vector of voxel dimensions of CT in mm.

SetGraphLobeColourmap(h, G)

set the colours of a network graph by lobe. G is the graph object and h is the plot. i.e. h = plot(G)

SetSegSkel(SegIndices, SkelIndices)

Each is a vector of linear indices in the frame of the reduced CT.

TQTube(LinkIndex, CaseDir, TubeType)

a handle class

Parameters

x – a variable

TaperBoxPlot(type)

requires lobe classification

View3D(mode)

View segmentation volume with different labels. In MATLAB’s volviewer. mode = ‘TaperGradient’, ‘generation’, ‘lobes’

airwaystack(link_index)

generate an airway’s interpolated slices into an array stack.

compareextent(populationstats, threshold)

threshold = minimum gen expected populationstats = table generated by summarising results from genperlobe over several images.

digraph()

TODO: REDUNDANT FUNCTION? compute edge weights

exportraw(savename)

export Glink table and arclengths and inner diameter measurements

extentstats()

make table of lobes

plot(type)

Default plot is a graph network representation. Optional input is to provide a list of edge labels indexed by the Glink property.

plot3(gen, show_node_txt)

Plot the airway tree in graph form, in 3D. nodes are in in image space. Set gen to the maximum number of generations to show. Original Function by Ashkan Pakzad on 27th July 2019.

vol3daxes(ax)

utility function for 3D volumetric plotting. Sets the aspect ratio according to voxel size and reverses the x axes for LPS viewing.

network

Base class of all functions

Tube is a really cool module.

TubeNetwork

Base class of all networks

class network.TubeNetwork(source, sourceinfo, seg, skel)

Bases: handle

TubeNetwork

description

Parameters

  • source – source image, e.g. CT

  • sourceinfo (struct) – header information from source

  • voxdim – [float, float, float] voxel dimensions in mm usually

  • seg – binary airway segmentation in the same grid space as source dimensions must match with source.

  • skel – skeleton based on segementation with no internal loops in the same grid space as source. Dimensions must match with source .

  • lims – reduced volume indices

  • max_plane_sz – max interpolated slice size

  • plane_sample_sz – interpolated slice pixel size

  • spline_sample_sz – mm interval to sample along branch arclength

  • skel_points – private, list of skeleton points

  • Dmap – float, array private, distance transform of seg

AddLungVol(lungmask)

get lung volume from optional lung mask for analysis that computes airway relative to the lung. the lung mask is not saved to reduce unnessary memory loads

AirwayCounts(type, showfig)

produce a table and barchart showing number of airways per generation number of airways per generation per lobe type is either generation or lobe showfig is a flag for plotting true by default

AirwayDigraph()

Generate the Airway Digraph, arrows point from central towards distal.

Converts the output from skel2graph into a digraph tree network, such that there are no loops and edges point from the trachea distally outwards.

AirwayImageAll()

Traverse all airway segments except the trachea.

ClassifySegmentation()

TODO: consider making this function more robust! label every branch in segmentation to AS branch index.

ComputeAirwayGen()

Indexes each airway generation by shortest path from carina

loop through graph nodes

ComputeAirwayLobes()

Indexes each airway’s lobe by implementing adapted algorithm, originally by Gu et al. 2012.

Get airway graph

ComputeBranchCharacteristics()

Add parent and child links, and calculate length of airways. Save these to class to keep track of airway characteristics.

Convert CT_point mm back to voxel ind

CullAirways(nodes)

remove airways beyond a given node from airway tree identify all edges from node outwards

DebugGraph()

TODO: consider moving graph plot to the default plot. First check for multiple ‘inedges’ to all nodes.

FilterBranches(percent)

Exclude airway branches that are too short/long based on extreme percentage specified. It considers based on their arclengths. This method overwrites property Gdigraph and rewrites Glink and Gnode. Reorganising how airways are connected to eachother.

FindCarina()

Finds the carina node by analysis of the directed graph produced by a breadth first search from the trachea node.

FindFWHMall()

Clear all FWHMesl cells

FindTracheaPaths()

Check if there are any edges between carina and top of trachea due to skeletonisation error (trachea is prone to skeletonisation errors)

GenerateSkel()

Generate the airway skeleton if skeleton not provided, generate one. NB: it is recommended to use the PTK generated skeleton. This will use skeleton3D: https://github.com/phi-max/skeleton3d-matlab

GetAreas()

Extract the inner area of all branches from FWHM results and output

GetDiameters()

Extract the inner area of all branches from FWHM results, convert to diameter and output.

GraphPlotIT()

graph plot for plotting intertapering relative to edgethicknes.

Plot and Visualise tangental vectors off spline sample points. 1/subsamp = proportion of spline points to sample, default subsamp = 2. link_index = airway indices to plot, default link_index = all.

PlotTree(gen, show_seg_txt, show_node_txt)

Raycast(interpslice, interpseg, center)

Compute Rays Getting the range limit of the ray which will be the shortest distance from the centre to the bounadry Need to find the limits of the raw

ReclassLobe(node, lobelabel, dryrun)

reclassify airways beyond a given node to a particular lobelabel. This method is useful for when the lobe classifcation algorithm fails. It performs a breadth-first-search (BFS) on the digraph starting at the given node, identifies all airways within it and reclassifys them. It also reclassifies the predecessing edge. Set dryrun = 1 if you want a preview of what edge indices will be changed without effecting any change.

ReclassLobeGen()

Reclassifies airway generations by their lobe rather than global branch distance from carina. Called automatically once lobes have been classified.

ReformatAirway(link_index, slice_idx)

get reformatted airway stack

Remove2nodeinedge(erroredge)

identify erroredges that appear more than once (with same node) TODO: edit to hand >2.

RemoveLink(link_exclude)

removes branches in link_exclude from AirQuant

RestoreOriginalGraphMap()

restore graph properties to their original state

SaveOriginalGraphMap()

restore graph properties to their original state

SegmentTaperAll(prunelength)

high level function to compute the segmental tapering measurement of all airways.

SetGraphLobeColourmap(h, G)

set the colours of a network graph by lobe. G is the graph object and h is the plot. i.e. h = plot(G)

SkelAngle()

make vector for all airways

StoreLobeClass()

initialise object

StoreOriginalGraphMap()

Stores the graph properties incase they are manipulated later. This is a mechanism so that they can be easily restored.

SuccessReport()

produce a table showing success of processing for each airway branch.

TaperBoxPlot(type)

requires lobe classification

TubeNetwork(source, sourceinfo, seg, skel)

Initialise the TubeNetwork class object.

description

Parameters

  • source (3D array) – CT loaded from nifti using niftiread.

  • sourceinfo (struct) – CT metadata loaded from nifti using niftiinfo.

  • seg (3D array) – Binary airway segmentation in the same grid space as CT. Dimensions must match with CT.

  • skel (3D array) – Binary airway centreline in the same grid space as CT. Dimensions must match with CT

View3D(mode)

View segmentation volume with different labels. In MATLAB’s volviewer. mode = ‘TaperGradient’, ‘generation’, ‘lobes’

generate an airway’s interpolated slices into an array stack.
